title: Code of Conduct
text: team, committed fostering collaborative, inclusive, respectful working environment. Code Conduct outlines expectations teamwork, communication, behavior ensure productive positive experience members. welcome diversity perspectives, skills, experiences, strive create environment voices heard respected.

title: Code of Conduct
text: team members : Communicate openly respectfully. Listen consider ‚Äôs ideas feedback. Fulfill assigned responsibilities contribute fairly project. proactive addressing concerns challenges. Support inclusive environment members feel comfortable participating.

title: Code of Conduct
text: following behaviors considered unacceptable within group: Dismissing undermining teammates‚Äô contributions. Failing complete assigned tasks without prior discussion. respecting agreed-upon deadlines meeting schedules. Engaging discriminatory, harassing, offensive behavior. Withholding project-related information affects group progress. form academic dishonesty, plagiarism unauthorized sharing work.

title: Code of Conduct
text: conflicts arise, : Address concerns within group first, respectful manner. Seek compromise discussion agreement. unresolved, escalate issue TA, instructor, project supervisor.

title: Code of Conduct
text: team member feels uncomfortable experiences violation Code Conduct, : Address issue privately involved person possible. Bring concerns group discussion. necessary, seek guidance course instructor TA.

title: Code of Conduct
text: Failure uphold Code Conduct may result : formal discussion team members. Reassignment responsibilities. Notification course instructor TA action.

title: Code of Conduct
text: participating project, members agree uphold Code Conduct contribute respectful, productive team environment.

title: NA
text: Thank interest contributing project! welcome contributions kinds, whether ‚Äôs reporting issues, suggesting new features, improving documentation.

title: NA
text: find bug, typo, issue project, please open issue following details: clear descriptive title. Steps reproduce issue (applicable). Expected actual behavior. relevant logs screenshots. opening new issue, please check similar one already exists.

title: NA
text: ‚Äôd like contribute bug fix, feature, documentation improvement, follow steps: Fork Repository: Click ‚ÄúFork‚Äù button GitHub repository page. Clone Fork: Create Branch: Make Changes ensure follow project‚Äôs coding style. Commit Changes: Push Changes: Open Pull Request: Go original repository click ‚ÄúNew Pull Request.‚Äù Select branch describe changes clearly. Reference related issues.
code: git https://github.com/DSCI-310-2025/airbnbtools.git cd airbnbtools git checkout -b feature-or-bugfix-name git add . git commit -m "Describe your changes" git push origin feature-or-bugfix-name

title: NA
text: Keep PRs small focused single issue feature. Include relevant tests applicable. Ensure code follows existing style conventions. Provide clear detailed description changes. PRs reviewed within 7 days project maintainers.

title: NA
text: contributors must abide Code Conduct ensure positive inclusive environment.

what: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: goal airbnbtools streamline process working Airbnb datasets, offering tools downloading, transforming, modeling data. package provides several functions automate tasks data acquisition, data cleaning, model training evaluation, helping make data analysis workflow efficient. can find documentation package following URL: airbnbtools Documentation

title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: can install development version airbnbtools GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("DSCI-310-2025/airbnbtools")

title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: airbnbtools package provides several useful functions data manipulation analysis. common tasks:

what: Convert selected columns to factor type
title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: function convert_columns_to_factor() converts specific columns data frame factors.
code: df <- data.frame(   room_type = c("Private room", "Entire home/apt"),   host_is_superhost = c("t", "f"),   city = c("Madrid", "Barcelona"),   weekdays = c(TRUE, FALSE),   price = c(100, 150) ) convert_columns_to_factor(df) #>         room_type host_is_superhost      city weekdays price #> 1    Private room                 t    Madrid     TRUE   100 #> 2 Entire home/apt                 f Barcelona    FALSE   150

title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: Use download_combine_data() download data multiple sources combine single data frame.
code: urls <- list(   "Vancouver_weekdays" = "https://example.com/vancouver_weekdays.csv",   "Toronto_weekends" = "https://example.com/toronto_weekends.csv" ) combined_df <- download_combine_data(urls) head(combined_df)

title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: function create_histogram_grid() generates saves grid histograms numeric columns data frame.
code: df <- data.frame(   price = c(100, 150, 200, 250),   size = c(20, 25, 30, 35),   rating = c(4.5, 4.0, 5.0, 3.5) ) out_path <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") create_histogram_grid(df, vars = c("price", "size", "rating"), output_path = out_path)

title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: Use evaluate_model() compute evaluation metrics (RMSE, MAE, R-squared) regression model.
code: df <- data.frame(x = 1:10, y = 2 * (1:10) + rnorm(10)) model <- lm(y ~ x, data = df) result <- evaluate_model(model, df, response_col = "y") print(result) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 3 #>    RMSE   MAE    R2 #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 0.865 0.703 0.972

what: Split data into training and testing sets
title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: split_train_test() function splits dataset training testing sets using stratified sampling.
code: df <- data.frame(x = rnorm(100), y = rnorm(100)) split_data <- split_train_test(df, response_col = "y", train_ratio = 0.75) str(split_data$train) #> 'data.frame':    76 obs. of  2 variables: #>  $ x: num  -0.1499 -0.6169 1.6517 0.0968 0.5916 ... #>  $ y: num  1.469 -1.14 0.522 -0.847 -0.4 ... str(split_data$test) #> 'data.frame':    24 obs. of  2 variables: #>  $ x: num  1.832 -0.569 2.178 -0.475 -1.533 ... #>  $ y: num  -2.428 -0.297 -2.089 -0.72 0.221 ...

what: Train a regression model using caret
title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: Use train_model() train regression model using caret package.
code: df <- data.frame(   price = rnorm(100, mean = 200, sd = 50),   size = rnorm(100, mean = 80, sd = 10),   rating = rnorm(100, mean = 4, sd = 0.5) ) model <- train_model(df) #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.2.3 #> Loading required package: lattice summary(model) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = .outcome ~ ., data = dat) #>  #> Residuals: #>      Min       1Q   Median       3Q      Max  #> -112.384  -30.214   -4.179   29.174  115.875  #>  #> Coefficients: #>             Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)     #> (Intercept) 244.9042    55.8091   4.388 2.91e-05 *** #> size         -0.5055     0.5286  -0.956    0.341     #> rating       -1.6094     9.6998  -0.166    0.869     #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #>  #> Residual standard error: 48.82 on 97 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared:  0.009906,   Adjusted R-squared:  -0.01051  #> F-statistic: 0.4853 on 2 and 97 DF,  p-value: 0.617

title: Tools for Working with Airbnb Datasets
text: validate_airbnb_data() function checks converts specified columns data frame factors.
code: df <- data.frame(   room_type = c("Entire home/apt", "Private room"),   host_is_superhost = c("t", "f"),   city = c("Berlin", "Paris"),   weekdays = c("Monday", "Tuesday") ) validate_airbnb_data(df)

code: df <- data.frame(   room_type = c("Private room", "Entire home/apt"),   host_is_superhost = c("t", "f"),   city = c("Madrid", "Barcelona"),   weekdays = c(TRUE, FALSE),   price = c(100, 150) ) convert_columns_to_factor(df) #>         room_type host_is_superhost      city weekdays price #> 1    Private room                 t    Madrid     TRUE   100 #> 2 Entire home/apt                 f Barcelona    FALSE   150

what: Create and save a grid of histograms for numeric variables ‚Äî create_histogram_grid
title: Create and save a grid of histograms for numeric variables ‚Äî create_histogram_grid
text: function generates histograms set numeric columns data frame saves grid plot.

title: Create and save a grid of histograms for numeric variables ‚Äî create_histogram_grid
code: create_histogram_grid(df, vars, output_path)

title: Create and save a grid of histograms for numeric variables ‚Äî create_histogram_grid
text: df data frame containing numeric columns vars character vector column names plot output_path string, path save output .png file

title: Create and save a grid of histograms for numeric variables ‚Äî create_histogram_grid
text: NULL (saves plot file)

title: Create and save a grid of histograms for numeric variables ‚Äî create_histogram_grid
code: df <- data.frame(   price = c(100, 150, 200, 250),   size = c(20, 25, 30, 35),   rating = c(4.5, 4.0, 5.0, 3.5) ) out_path <- tempfile(fileext = ".png") create_histogram_grid(df, vars = c("price", "size", "rating"), output_path = out_path) file.exists(out_path)  # should return TRUE #> [1] TRUE

what: This function downloads Airbnb data from given URLs, adds metadata, and combines them. ‚Äî download_combine_data
title: This function downloads Airbnb data from given URLs, adds metadata, and combines them. ‚Äî download_combine_data
text: function downloads Airbnb data given URLs, adds metadata, combines .

title: This function downloads Airbnb data from given URLs, adds metadata, and combines them. ‚Äî download_combine_data
code: download_combine_data(urls)

title: This function downloads Airbnb data from given URLs, adds metadata, and combines them. ‚Äî download_combine_data
text: urls named list names indicate city time period (weekdays/weekends) values corresponding dataset URLs.

title: This function downloads Airbnb data from given URLs, adds metadata, and combines them. ‚Äî download_combine_data
text: combined data frame added city weekdays column.

title: This function downloads Airbnb data from given URLs, adds metadata, and combines them. ‚Äî download_combine_data
code: # Not run because this requires internet and real URLs: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ urls <- list(   "Vancouver_weekdays" = "https://example.com/vancouver_weekdays.csv",   "Toronto_weekends" = "https://example.com/toronto_weekends.csv" ) combined_df <- download_combine_data(urls) head(combined_df) } # }

title: Evaluate a regression model ‚Äî evaluate_model
text: function computes common evaluation metrics (RMSE, MAE, R-squared) regression model.

title: Evaluate a regression model ‚Äî evaluate_model
code: evaluate_model(model, data, response_col)

title: Evaluate a regression model ‚Äî evaluate_model
text: model regression model object can used predict() data data frame containing data evaluate model response_col string specifying name actual response column data

title: Evaluate a regression model ‚Äî evaluate_model
text: tibble RMSE, MAE, R-squared values

title: Evaluate a regression model ‚Äî evaluate_model
code: # Example with a simple linear model df <- data.frame(   x = 1:10,   y = 2 * (1:10) + rnorm(10) ) model <- lm(y ~ x, data = df) result <- evaluate_model(model, df, response_col = "y") print(result) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 3 #>    RMSE   MAE    R2 #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1  1.04 0.834 0.971

what: Split data into training and testing sets ‚Äî split_train_test
title: Split data into training and testing sets ‚Äî split_train_test
text: function splits dataset training testing sets using stratified sampling based response variable.

title: Split data into training and testing sets ‚Äî split_train_test
code: split_train_test(data, response_col, train_ratio = 0.8, seed = 123)

title: Split data into training and testing sets ‚Äî split_train_test
text: data data frame containing dataset split response_col string specifying name response column train_ratio numeric value indicating proportion data used training (default 0.8) seed integer seed reproducibility (default 123)

title: Split data into training and testing sets ‚Äî split_train_test
text: list containing two elements: 'train' 'test', data frames

title: Split data into training and testing sets ‚Äî split_train_test
code: df <- data.frame(   x = rnorm(100),   y = rnorm(100) ) split_data <- split_train_test(df, response_col = "y", train_ratio = 0.75) str(split_data$train) #> 'data.frame':	76 obs. of  2 variables: #>  $ x: num  0.629 2.065 -1.631 0.512 -1.863 ... #>  $ y: num  -1.399 0.259 -0.442 0.569 2.127 ... str(split_data$test) #> 'data.frame':	24 obs. of  2 variables: #>  $ x: num  -0.5537 -0.522 -0.0526 0.543 -0.8268 ... #>  $ y: num  -0.209 0.425 -1.684 0.249 -0.528 ...

text: train_data data frame containing training set. Must include column called price.

title: Train a regression model using caret ‚Äî train_model
text: trained caret model.

title: Train a regression model using caret ‚Äî train_model
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(caret) df <- data.frame(   price = rnorm(100, mean = 200, sd = 50),   size = rnorm(100, mean = 80, sd = 10),   rating = rnorm(100, mean = 4, sd = 0.5) ) model <- train_model(df) summary(model) } # }

title: Convert selected columns to factor type ‚Äî validate_airbnb_data
text: data frame specified columns converted factors

title: Convert selected columns to factor type ‚Äî validate_airbnb_data
code: # Create dummy data df <- data.frame(   realSum = c(100, 200, 300),   room_type = c("Entire home/apt", "Private room", "Shared room"),   person_capacity = c(2, 1, 3),   bedrooms = c(1, 1, 2),   cleanliness_rating = c(4.5, 4, 3.5),   guest_satisfaction_overall = c(4, 5, 4),   lng = c(13.4050, 2.3522, -0.1276),   lat = c(52.5200, 48.8566, 51.5074),   city = c("berlin", "paris", "london"),   weekdays = c("Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday") )  # Validate the dummy data validate_airbnb_data(df) #> Airbnb dataset passed all validation checks.
